HelpXML.Title: addt
HelpXML.Purpose: addt produces the t test for an additional explanatory variable

Item.Name: y
Item.ShortDesc: A vector with n elements that contains the response variable.
Item.TypeInd: y can be both a row of column vector.

Item.Name: X
Item.ShortDesc: Data matrix of explanatory variables (also called 'regressors').
Item.TypeInd: Rows of X represent observations and columns represent variables.
Item.LongDesc: Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: w
Item.LongDesc: n-x-1 vector containing the additional explanatory variable whose t test must be computed.

Item.Name: intercept
Item.LongDesc: If 1, a model with constant term will be fitted (default), if 0, no constant term will be included.

Item.Name: la
Item.LongDesc: It specifies for which Box Cox transformation parameter it is necessary to compute the t statistic for the additional variable. If la is an empty value (default) no transformation is used.

Item.Name: plots
Item.LongDesc: If plots=1 the added variable plot is produced else (default) no plot is produced.

Item.Name: units
Item.LongDesc: Vector containing the list of units which has to be removed in the computation of the test. The default is to use all units

Item.Name: textlab
Item.ShortDesc: Labels of units in the plot.
Item.LongDesc: If textlab='' default no text label is written on the plot for units else text label of units are added on the plot

Item.Name: FontSize
Item.LongDesc: It controls the fontsize of the labels of the axes and eventual plot labels. Default value is 12

Item.Name: SizeAxesNum
Item.LongDesc: It controls the fontsize of the numbers of the axes. Default value is 10
